intro: Stylidium choreanthum, commonly known as the red-stemmed starburry, is a small flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae, which includes plants known for their vibrant, often red or orange flowers. The plant features slender, erect stems and produces clusters of star-shaped flowers that are typically bright red or orange in color. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Stylidium choreanthum is adapted to drought conditions and is a characteristic component of coastal and inland shrublands.
